clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction and Testing of Antigenic Sites of the AIDS Virus, HTLV-III Recognized by T Lymphocytes for the Development of Synthetic Vaccines
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction and Testing of Antigenic Sites of the AIDS Virus, HTLV-III Recognized by T Lymphocytes for the Development of Synthetic Vaccines
clinical_study.source: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)

brief_summary.textblock: Subjects are healthy adult volunteers either at high risk for HIV infection or already known to be seropositive, who will donate blood for in vitro tests of T-cell function and in vitro responses to synthetic peptides corresponding to sequences from HIV proteins.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects are healthy adult volunteers either at high risk for HIV infection or already known to be seropositive, who will donate blood for in vitro tests of T-cell function and in vitro responses to synthetic peptides corresponding to sequences from HIV proteins.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria for the at risk group will be a statement from the donor that he is an active homosexual or bisexual.
Homosexual donors must not have AIDS.
